The white flowers appear like they are made of clay. The design is lovely. However, I have short to medium-length fine curly hair and no matter what I do I cannot get this to stay. It immediately wants to fall out. I feel this is best applied by someone who is a stylist and perhaps can affix this with some pins. It is also probably best for someone who has thick long hair than someone with fine hair like me.

I love this but am disappointed it does not work for me. Also, this can be used for any elegant occasion and not just by a bride.

The current price of $19.99 is competitively priced for this. Note that I ordered the style called "Silver 1." However, what is pictured is a lot longer than what I received. Mine is more tightly compacted and half the size and there were no wires I could stretch out. business_name:
Good Opportunity To Try A Lot Of Different Products Review For: Burt'S Bees Baby Bath Time Kit With Ultra Gentle Lotion, 1 Count

I Have Been A Fan Of Burt’S Bees Products For Years. I Welcomed The Opportunity To Try This Assortment.

I Found The Bubble Bath To Be A Good Product For My Household. Lots Of Bubbles, No Scent That I Could Detect And An Easy To Use Dispenser. The Body Wash/Shampoo Is Fine As A Body Wash And I Love The Foam Dispenser. It Works Ok For An Infant As Shampoo But I Don’T Like It As Shampoo For A Toddler With More Hair. The Wipes Are Great And I Like The Small Package So They Stay Moist Longer. The Lotion Is Quite Thin As Most Baby Lotion Is So You Have To Be Careful When Opening Or Dispensing It Because You Can Find Yourself With Way More Than You Wanted Very Quickly. I Also Could Not Discern Any Scent On The Lotion. The Oil I Only Use To Pour Just A Tad Into A Bath So Soften And Moisten The Skin. You Do Have To Be Careful Not To Put Too Much In Or The Tub Will Become A Slip And Slide.

Overall: Nice Products, Not Perfect But Would Make A Nice Gift, Comes In A Gift Box.
address: nan
review_text:
Good opportunity to try a lot of different products Review for: Burt's Bees Baby Bath Time Kit With Ultra Gentle Lotion, 1 Count

I have been a fan of Burt’s Bees products for years. I welcomed the opportunity to try this assortment.

I found the bubble bath to be a good product for my household. Lots of bubbles, no scent that I could detect and an easy to use dispenser. The body wash/shampoo is fine as a body wash and I love the foam dispenser. It works ok for an infant as shampoo but I don’t like it as shampoo for a toddler with more hair. The wipes are great and I like the small package so they stay moist longer. The lotion is quite thin as most baby lotion is so you have to be careful when opening or dispensing it because you can find yourself with way more than you wanted very quickly. I also could not discern any scent on the lotion. The oil I only use to pour just a tad into a bath so soften and moisten the skin. You do have to be careful not to put too much in or the tub will become a slip and slide.

Overall: Nice products, not perfect but would make a nice gift, comes in a gift box.

business_name:
Confusing Marketing..... The Seller Really Should Change Their Description Of This Hair Dryer.

First, The Pictures Make It Look As If You Can Use The Concentrators In Either The Vertical Or Horizontal Position And This Isn'T True At All. In The Horizontal Position, The Concentrator Will Fall Off Because It Will Not Lock.....See Promotion Picture And My Uploaded Photo.

****This May Not Seem Like A Big Deal Until You Start Using It And Have To Adjust The Direction With Your Wrist.****

Second, The Description States The Wattage Is Between 1800 To 2000 But The Label Says 1800 Watts Only....See Description Paragraph And My Uploaded Photo.

While The Blow Dryer Is Cute And An Obvious Design Copy From The Dyson Blow Dryer (Seems China Has Been Copying Dyson These Days But Can'T Match The Superior Quality Of Dyson), It'S Kinda Heavy And Gets Too Hot, Even On The Medium Heat Setting. I Had To Turn On The Cool Shot To Offset The Heat.

If You Have Hand Arthritis, Carpal Tunnel, Shoulder Arthritis, Etc, This Will Give You Some Trouble Due To The Heaviness, Along With The Inability To Switch The Concentrator Into The Horizontal Position.

2 Star Deduction For The Deceptive Advertising, Lack Of Concentrator Versatility And Heaviness.
address: nan
review_text:
Confusing marketing..... The seller really should change their description of this hair dryer.

First, the pictures make it look as if you can use the concentrators in either the vertical or horizontal position and this isn't true at all. In the horizontal position, the concentrator will fall off because it will not lock.....see promotion picture and my uploaded photo.

****This may not seem like a big deal until you start using it and have to adjust the direction with your wrist.****

Second, the description states the wattage is between 1800 to 2000 but the label says 1800 watts only....see description paragraph and my uploaded photo.

While the blow dryer is cute and an obvious design copy from the Dyson blow dryer (seems China has been copying Dyson these days but can't match the superior quality of Dyson), it's kinda heavy and gets too hot, even on the medium heat setting. I had to turn on the cool shot to offset the heat.

If you have hand arthritis, carpal tunnel, shoulder arthritis, etc, this will give you some trouble due to the heaviness, along with the inability to switch the concentrator into the horizontal position.

2 star deduction for the deceptive advertising, lack of concentrator versatility and heaviness.

business_name: Dry Rot Dropper, My Bottle Of Oil Arrived Rancid- Had To Be Trashed Hopefully The Bottle I Received Was An Oversight In Aging Inventory. My Bottle Was Hard To Get Open, And Once I Did I Could Immediately Tell That The Oil Had Oxidized. Totally Unusable As It Was Truly Rancid. The Oil Was Thick, All Cakds Up Around The Topper, And The Bulb Dropper Was Rock Hard. I Was Unable To Squeeze It. I Think The Dropper Had Dry Rotted, Then That Allowed Air Into The Bottle, Leading To A Rancid Product. It Was Evident Not Just Based On Looks, But Also That Super Special Aroma Of A Rancid Oil. Too Bad, As I Love Seed Oils For Use On Body, Face, And Hair. This Had To Go Directly Into Garbage. Not At All Usable As Something With Anti-Oxidants Become Pro-Oxidant When Exposed To Air. This Is Going To Do Exactly The Opposite Of What You Want. Again, I Give Benefit Of The Doubt. I Imagine It Was A Bad Bottle And Hopefully Not At All What Anyone Should Expect. review_text:
Moisturizes as promised and mattifies beautifully I have used a few products by Follain to this date so I was curious to see how this mattifying moisturizer would perform. It comes in a little pump dispenser. It is on the more inexpensive side of the spectrum. The design is in line with the rest of the product line. The moisturizer is pretty much fragrance free, it maybe has a hint of a fragrance that is pleasant but very subtle.

The moisturizer itself is very lightweight. It absorbs very quickly into the skin and leaves no residue behind. You can instantly notice the difference between where you put it and where you didn’t. It mattifies the skin nicely and really neutralizes the oils in your skin nicely. I was rather impressed by that to be honest. My skin looked great, nice and matte but still moisturized. It felt smooth to the touch but looked good. All in all I was pretty impressed and liked how my face felt and looked when I use this moisturizer.

business_name: Ineffective And Irritating I Have Been Using The Oil-Free Eye Makeup Remover For Several Years, So I Thought I Would Try This. I Don'T Recommend It. It Did A Good Job Of Dissolving Mascara, But Really Just Smeared It Around. I Had To Use Several Pumps Of Oil To Get The Mascara Dissolved, But Then Could Not Get It To Rinse Off. I Tried Using A Cotton Pad, But Still Had Mascara Residue Around My Eyes. My Eyes Were Irritated And Blurry (That Stuff Hurts When It Gets In The Eyes) After Using This, Even When I Rinsed With Water. I Ended Up Using An Additional Product To Get All The Mascara Off. The Instructions On The Bottle Make It Sound Like You Can Just Pump, Massage, And Rinse Off Your Makeup. That Is Not The Case At All. I Love Neutrogena Products, But Can'T Recommend This One. I Will Return It And Go Back To Their Oil-Free Eye Makeup Remover.
address: nan
review_text: Ineffective and irritating I have been using the oil-free eye makeup remover for several years, so I thought I would try this. I don't recommend it. It did a good job of dissolving mascara, but really just smeared it around. I had to use several pumps of oil to get the mascara dissolved, but then could not get it to rinse off. I tried using a cotton pad, but still had mascara residue around my eyes. My eyes were irritated and blurry (that stuff hurts when it gets in the eyes) after using this, even when I rinsed with water. I ended up using an additional product to get all the mascara off. The instructions on the bottle make it sound like you can just pump, massage, and rinse off your makeup. That is not the case at all. I love Neutrogena products, but can't recommend this one. I will return it and go back to their oil-free eye makeup remover.

business_name:
Lip Applicators [[Videoid:5C532F5F5D94B55721Fdf6748Ddcc641]] I Want You To Try These For Two Reasons, First Of All Because I Often Make My Own Diy Cosmetics, Including Lip Balms And Glosses. These Applicators Are Perfect To Use With Those.
Also, Have You Ever Found That Perfect Shade Of Lipstick That You Can'T Live Without, Only To Find That It'S Been Discontinued? These Applicators Help Get Every Last Bit Of Lipstick Out Of A Tube So That You Can Enjoy It Longer.
As You Can See, The Colors Are Pretty Bright. I Think That These Would Look More Upscale In More Muted Colors, And If That'S What You'Re Going For, I Would Suggest Getting The Other Color Option In These. To Be Honest, What I Would Prefer, Is If They Were Paper Or Wood Instead Of Plastic. A Little More Environmentally Friendly.
Still, They'Re Good For What They Are. The Doe-Foot Tip Is Slanted, Just Like With Your Favorite Tubed Liquid Lip Products. They Are Fuzzy, So They Hold The Lip Product.
Makeup Artists, As Well As Their Clientele, Will Appreciate That These Can Be Used Once And Then Tossed. No Spreading Of Germs And Bacteria.
address: nan
review_text:
Lip applicators [[VIDEOID:5c532f5f5d94b55721fdf6748ddcc641]] I want you to try these for two reasons, first of all because I often make my own DIY cosmetics, including lip balms and glosses. These applicators are perfect to use with those.
Also, have you ever found that perfect shade of lipstick that you can't live without, only to find that it's been discontinued? These applicators help get every last bit of lipstick out of a tube so that you can enjoy it longer.
As you can see, the colors are pretty bright. I think that these would look more upscale in more muted colors, and if that's what you're going for, I would suggest getting the other color option in these. To be honest, what I would prefer, is if they were paper or wood instead of plastic. A little more environmentally friendly.
Still, they're good for what they are. The doe-foot tip Is slanted, just like with your favorite tubed liquid lip products. They are fuzzy, so they hold the lip product.
Makeup artists, as well as their clientele, will appreciate that these can be used once and then tossed. No spreading of germs and bacteria.

business_name:
Mine Had Defects First, The Good: Hair Is Soft, Silky And Only A Tiny Bit Too Shiny. It Has Good Style And Only Shed A Small Amount On Removing From Package And Brushing. Not Too Much Hair, But Not Thin Or Flimsy. Has Two Combs At The Top In Front To Secure Wig, And The Adjustable Latches At The Neck. I Was Prepared To Love It Forever And Buy Ten More. However:
The Not So Good And The Bad: The Color Is Flat Black, There Is No Natural Color Variation And Looks Like A Poor Dye Job, The Ear Tabs Did Not Align With My Actual Ears, And So Poked Out To The Sides A Bit. The Hair Line Would Not Lay Flat To My Head, And When I Tried To Pull Some Of The Front Strands To The Side To Keep Them Out Of My Eyes, I Saw That The Seams Are Thick And Obvious. Since It Has A Bit Of Lace At The Top I Figured To Reset The Part, But There Is A Seam In The Middle Of The Lace, So Parting It
In Any Other Location Within The Lace Area Literally Shows A Fat Black Seam.

Now, I Am Not A Wig Expert. I Don'T Know How To Make A Mediocre Wig Great, And To This Wig'S Credit, It Is Better Than Mediocre. So If You Happen To Be One Of Those People With Such Knowledge, This Is A Fabulous Wig To Mess With And Work Your Magic On. And Perhaps My Particular Wig Is A Defect That Slipped Through, But Regardless, It Is A Disappointment To Me. I Would Return It, But I Made The Mistake Of Cutting The Lace Right Away (Like I Said, I Was Excited About How Great The Wig Looked Lol). Perhaps Down The Road I Will Find A Magic Maker Who Can Make My Wig Work For Me, So It'S Not A Total Loss. Just Disappointing.
address: nan
review_text:
Mine had defects First, the good: hair is soft, silky and only a tiny bit too shiny. It has good style and only shed a small amount on removing from package and brushing. Not too much hair, but not thin or flimsy. Has two combs at the top in front to secure wig, and the adjustable latches at the neck. I was prepared to love it forever and buy ten more. However:
The not so good and the bad: the color is flat black, there is no natural color variation and looks like a poor dye job, the ear tabs did not align with my actual ears, and so poked out to the sides a bit. The hair line would not lay flat to my head, and when I tried to pull some of the front strands to the side to keep them out of my eyes, I saw that the seams are thick and obvious. Since it has a bit of lace at the top I figured to reset the part, but there is a seam in the middle of the lace, so parting it
in any other location within the lace area literally shows a fat black seam.

Now, I am not a wig expert. I don't know how to make a mediocre wig great, and to this wig's credit, it is better than mediocre. So if you happen to be one of those people with such knowledge, this is a fabulous wig to mess with and work your magic on. And perhaps my particular wig is a defect that slipped through, but regardless, it is a disappointment to me. I would return it, but I made the mistake of cutting the lace right away (like I said, I was excited about how great the wig looked lol). Perhaps down the road I will find a magic maker who can make my wig work for me, so it's not a total loss. Just disappointing.

business_name:
I Wish I Knew How To Use All The Brushes... I Was So Excited To Receive This Set. I Already Had A Brush Set From Mary Kay, That I Love; But, I It Only Has 5 Brushes.
Since I Like To Contour And Highlight (Subtly), I Mostly Needed Brushes For This.
Researching Sets Produced A Huge Price Range. One Could Spend Upwards Of $70.00, With Comparable Brush Sets. Yikes!! This Set Is Much More Affordable. The Brush Handles Are Solid And Bristles Are Firmly Attached. Some Brushes Are Softer Than Others.

So, If They Are Quality Brushes And The Price Is Reasonable, Why Am I Only Rating Them 4 Stars? I Had No Clue What Each Brush Was For, And The Internet Wasn'T Very Helpful:(
If The Brushes Had Been Labeled, Or There Had Been An Insert Explaining The Function/Functions Of Each Brush--It Would Have Received 5 Stars. Add Pictures/Diagrams For Tips On Use, Even Better. I Would Be Willing To Pay A Little Extra For An Easy To Clean Roll-Up Case For The Brushes. A Girl Needs To Keep Her Brushes Clean. That Is A Feature, I Believe Many Look For. I Travel A Lot, So My Roll Up Bag (For My Other Set) Is Essential.
As It Is, Cosmopolitan Magazine'S Website Has An Article On How To Use Different Makeup Brushes. It Was Helpful For A Few Of The Brushes, Which I Now Use Everyday.

What I Love:
*The Sponges Are Fabulous For Applying Foundation And Blending After You Contour/Highlight.
*The Large, Angled Brush Is Great For Applying Blush, So It Looks More Natural.
*The Large, Pointed Brush Does A Nice Job, When Adding Bronzer To Contour.
*The Large, Round Brush Is What I Rely On For Swirling On Powder.
*The Small, Pointed Brush Is Phenomenal At Applying Color At Applying Contour Eye Shadow.
* I Use The Small, Tall Bristled, Rounded Brush To Blend The Areas Of Shadow On My Eyes That Need Softening.

What I Didn'T Like:
*Obviously, Not Knowing What Each Brush Is For.
*The Eyeshadow? Brushes Use Too Much Product And Application Is Sparse. I Believe It'S Because The Bristles Are Stiffer Than What I Usually Use.
*No Case To Keep Them Clean, Which Leads Me To Look For Alternative Solutions. Leaving Them Out In The Air, Exposed, Is A Bad Idea. Think Of The Germs In The Air, Especially If You Keep Them On The Bathroom Sink. Eww! Bacteria Grows Quickly And Can Cause Infections, Such As Pink Eye.
User Tip: I Use Baby Shampoo To Wash My Brushes. It Is Gentle On Your Brushes And It Gets The Job Done.
I Received This Product At A Discount, In Exchange For My Honest Feedback And Unbiased Review.
address: nan
review_text:
i wish i knew how to use ALL the brushes... I was so excited to receive this set. I already had a brush set from Mary Kay, that I love; but, I it only has 5 brushes.
Since I like to contour and highlight (subtly), I mostly needed brushes for this.
Researching sets produced a huge price range. One could spend upwards of $70.00, with comparable brush sets. Yikes!! This set is much more affordable. The brush handles are solid and bristles are firmly attached. Some brushes are softer than others.

So, if they are quality brushes and the price is reasonable, why am I only rating them 4 stars? I had no clue what each brush was for, and the internet wasn't very helpful:(
If the brushes had been labeled, or there had been an insert explaining the function/functions of each brush--it would have received 5 stars. Add pictures/diagrams for tips on use, even better. I would be willing to pay a little extra for an easy to clean roll-up case for the brushes. A girl needs to keep her brushes clean. That is a feature, I believe many look for. I travel a lot, so my roll up bag (for my other set) is essential.
As it is, Cosmopolitan magazine's website has an article on how to use different makeup brushes. It was helpful for a few of the brushes, which I now use everyday.

What I love:
*The sponges are fabulous for applying foundation and blending after you contour/highlight.
*The large, angled brush is great for applying blush, so it looks more natural.
*The large, pointed brush does a nice job, when adding bronzer to contour.
*The large, round brush is what I rely on for swirling on powder.
*The small, pointed brush is phenomenal at applying color at applying contour eye shadow.
* I use the small, tall bristled, rounded brush to blend the areas of shadow on my eyes that need softening.

What I didn't like:
*Obviously, not knowing what each brush is for.
*The eyeshadow? brushes use too much product and application is sparse. I believe it's because the bristles are stiffer than what I usually use.
*No case to keep them clean, which leads me to look for alternative solutions. Leaving them out in the air, exposed, is a bad idea. Think of the germs in the air, especially if you keep them on the bathroom sink. Eww! Bacteria grows quickly and can cause infections, such as pink eye.
User Tip: I use baby shampoo to wash my brushes. It is gentle on your brushes and it gets the job done.
I received this product at a discount, in exchange for my honest feedback and unbiased review.

business_name:
It’S A Decent Idea, It Worked, But Not With The Included Suction Cups I Drive My Wife Nuts When I Trim My Beard In The Bathroom - I Try To Catch All The Clippings, But Without Something Like This, It Does Not Work Well. I Thought I”D Give This A Try - It Seems Like A Great Idea, But...

1. It Arrived With 1 Plastic Bib, 2 Suction Cups With Hooks, And 1 Shaving Cream Brush.
2. The Plastic Bib Feels Okay - It’S A Thin Plastic, But It Should Last For A Decent Amount Of Time. It Is Not As Nice As Most Of The Kinds I’Ve Experienced Or We Own For Haircutting
3. Its Stitching Is Okay - I Think It’Ll Last Decently
4. There Are Two Loops On The Ends You Will Attach To The Suction Cups.
5. The Suction Cups - Are Worthless. This Is Why It Gets The 4 Stars - I Would Have Given It 3 Stars If We Didn’T Have Our Own Suction Cups To Use Instead Of Theirs. One Of The Two That Came With It Stuck For 5 - 10 Seconds Before It Stopped Working Altogether. The Other Suction Cup Doesn’T Even Look Right - It Looks Like It Never Worked And Was Not Made Properly.
6. We Have Suction Cups (Bought On Amazon) We Were Able To Use - I Looped That Part Of The Bib Onto Them, Which Worked, But Not Designed For This, They Would Fall Off. I’Ll End Up Taping Them To It - At Least That Way I’Ll Be Able To Use It.
7. It Fit Me Fine. It Felt Fine - Just Like A Haircut Cape. The White Looks Weird - I’M Used To The Far More Common Black - But At The Same Time I Think It’Ll Show The Beard Hair Really Well.
8. I Did Notice That As I Go In Closer To The Mirror To See What I’M Doing It Folds Over In Front Of Me And Isn’T As Trapped Out - Be Aware Of This Because It’S Easy To Start Missing The Catch In The Bib.

Overall It’S A Decent Thing To Have And It’Ll Make My Wife Happy Not Getting The Beard Clippings All Over The Place. This Could Be A Little Nicer - A Little Thicker Plastic, Much Better Suction Cups - Which Would Easily Earn It A 5 Star Rating. But For What It Is, I’M Happy To Have It. If It Lasts, It’Ll Be Great.
address: nan
review_text:
It’s a decent idea, it worked, but not with the included suction cups I drive my wife nuts when I trim my beard in the bathroom - I try to catch all the clippings, but without something like this, it does not work well. I thought I”d give this a try - it seems like a great idea, but...

1. It arrived with 1 plastic bib, 2 suction cups with hooks, and 1 shaving cream brush.
2. The plastic bib feels okay - it’s a thin plastic, but it should last for a decent amount of time. It is not as nice as most of the kinds I’ve experienced or we own for haircutting
3. Its stitching is okay - I think it’ll last decently
4. There are two loops on the ends you will attach to the suction cups.
5. The suction cups - are worthless. This is why it gets the 4 stars - I would have given it 3 stars if we didn’t have our own suction cups to use instead of theirs. One of the two that came with it stuck for 5 - 10 seconds before it stopped working altogether. The other suction cup doesn’t even look right - it looks like it never worked and was not made properly.
6. We have suction cups (bought on Amazon) we were able to use - I looped that part of the bib onto them, which worked, but not designed for this, they would fall off. I’ll end up taping them to it - at least that way I’ll be able to use it.
7. It fit me fine. It felt fine - just like a haircut cape. The white looks weird - I’m used to the far more common black - but at the same time I think it’ll show the beard hair really well.
8. I did notice that as I go in closer to the mirror to see what I’m doing it folds over in front of me and isn’t as trapped out - be aware of this because it’s easy to start missing the catch in the bib.

Overall it’s a decent thing to have and it’ll make my wife happy not getting the beard clippings all over the place. This could be a little nicer - a little thicker plastic, much better suction cups - which would easily earn it a 5 star rating. But for what it is, I’m happy to have it. If it lasts, it’ll be great.

business_name: Nice Masks, Nice Results! I’Ve Tried Several Different Karuna Masks...They’Re All Good, But Some Are Better Than Others.  This Particular Set Is A Great Mix Of Masks Designed To Help With Different Needs, Including Hydrating, Soothing And Brightening.  The Masks Are Individually Wrapped And Presented In A Box That Opens Like A Book, With Suggestions For Which Masks To Use On Which Days.  The Packaging Is Nice And These Would Make A Great Gift.  The Masks Are Very Saturated (Overly Saturated, Imo) With Serum, With Plenty Left Over To Use On My Neck.  They’Re Large Enough To Easily Cover My Entire Face, And Come With A Paper Backing That Makes Them Easy To To Unfold.  Because They’Re So Saturated They Easily Slip While On My Face, Which Makes It Impossible To Do Anything Other Than Sit Still For The 20-30 Minutes I Wear Them.  Also, There’S So Much Serum Left On My Face After I Remove The Masks, It’S Impossible For My Skin To Absorb It All.  I’Ve Discovered That Lightly Splashing My Face With Cold Water Helps Remove The Excess Serum And My Skin Fully Dries More Quickly.  Ultimately, All Of The Face Masks Left My Skin Very Soft And Hydrated, And A Few Of Them Plumped My Skin And Created A Lovely Even Skin Tone.  There Is One Set Of Eye Masks In The Kit And That That Were Surprisingly Light And Effective, Reducing Puffiness And Brightening My Eyes.  These Are A Tiny Bit Pricey, But They’Re A Nice Quality And I Like Having A Set Of Masks That Cover A Range Of Needs.
address: nan
review_text: Nice masks, nice results! I’ve tried several different Karuna masks...they’re all good, but some are better than others. This particular set is a great mix of masks designed to help with different needs, including hydrating, soothing and brightening. The masks are individually wrapped and presented in a box that opens like a book, with suggestions for which masks to use on which days. The packaging is nice and these would make a great gift. The masks are very saturated (overly saturated, IMO) with serum, with plenty left over to use on my neck. They’re large enough to easily cover my entire face, and come with a paper backing that makes them easy to to unfold. Because they’re so saturated they easily slip while on my face, which makes it impossible to do anything other than sit still for the 20-30 minutes I wear them. Also, there’s so much serum left on my face after I remove the masks, it’s impossible for my skin to absorb it all. I’ve discovered that lightly splashing my face with cold water helps remove the excess serum and my skin fully dries more quickly. Ultimately, all of the face masks left my skin very soft and hydrated, and a few of them plumped my skin and created a lovely even skin tone. There is one set of eye masks in the kit and that that were surprisingly light and effective, reducing puffiness and brightening my eyes. These are a tiny bit pricey, but they’re a nice quality and I like having a set of masks that cover a range of needs.

review_text:
My skin is so soft! I really like this cream! The packaging is super cute, that I don't want to throw the box away. It's a pretty good sized cream. I think this will last me 1-3 months, depending on how often I use it.

It sort of smells like lime, but it's not exactly a citrus smell. Even though it shows images of avocado, it doesn't really smell like avocado. It has a gel-like consistency. A little goes a long way, so I recommend only using a little, and adding more as needed. Thankfully, the smell is subtle once you rub it into your skin, and it is not overpowering at all.

Normally, my skin is too sensitive to have any scented lotion, so I usually use unscented lotion that contains oatmeal. I put the Mascream on my face, and it stung a teeny tiny bit, but nothing like most scented lotions. I massaged it into my skin, and it feels really soft. You need to let it sink in and dry before you put on any makeup, otherwise it will be too much. I think I prefer this as a night time cream.

I got this for free in exchange for my honest review.

business_name: Rough Reaction It'S Kind Of Funny, I Don'T Have That Much Gray In My Beard But There'S Some And No One Has Ever Said Anything About It Looking Bad. The Few That Comment Say It Looks Nice Since My Beard Has Blacks, Several Shades Of Dark Brown But It Annoys Me! The Grizzly Natural Beard Color Works Pretty Good For Me But I Was Wanting Something To Completely Wipe Out The Gray Hair. I Tried This Godefroy Tint Kit And Was Very Disappointed With It. After Testing It And Finding The Right Mixture (Wife Helped), I Applied It To 4 Areas That Have Graying. Both Cheeks Have A Little Strip Of Gray And At The Top Of My Sideburns Where They Connect With My Hair (I'M Bald So Taking A Guess). I Left It On For The Directed Time, Started Washing It Off And One Sideburn Started Burning. It Wasn'T A Terrible Burn But It Was Bad Enough To Speed Me Up. When I Got Out Of The Shower, I Had A Red Mark About 2 Inches Long Right Beside The Top Of My Sideburn. I Put Some Aloe On It And Went To Bed. The Next Morning, I Got Up And The Red Spot Was Peeling Like It Was Sunburn! It Had Burnt Me To Some Extent. What Color Did Go On Wasn'T That Good. Maybe I Should Have Used Black. I Might Try It Again In The Future And Try To Be More Careful About Letting It Get On Unprotected, No Hair, Areas Of My Skin But For Now, I Would Only Recommend It If You'Re Comfortable In Your Ability To Keep It On The Hair.
address: nan
review_text: Rough reaction It's kind of funny, I don't have that much gray in my beard but there's some and no one has ever said anything about it looking bad. The few that comment say it looks nice since my beard has blacks, several shades of dark brown but it annoys me! The Grizzly natural beard color works pretty good for me but I was wanting something to completely wipe out the gray hair. I tried this Godefroy Tint Kit and was very disappointed with it. After testing it and finding the right mixture (wife helped), I applied it to 4 areas that have graying. Both cheeks have a little strip of gray and at the top of my sideburns where they connect with my hair (I'm bald so taking a guess). I left it on for the directed time, started washing it off and one sideburn started burning. It wasn't a terrible burn but it was bad enough to speed me up. When I got out of the shower, I had a red mark about 2 inches long right beside the top of my sideburn. I put some aloe on it and went to bed. The next morning, I got up and the red spot was peeling like it was sunburn! It had burnt me to some extent. What color did go on wasn't that good. Maybe I should have used black. I might try it again in the future and try to be more careful about letting it get on unprotected, no hair, areas of my skin but for now, I would only recommend it if you're comfortable in your ability to keep it on the hair.

Predictably, I Can'T Tell That It 'Helped Supercharge Collagen Production,' Or 'Lift Sagging Skin,' Or 'Reduce The Appearance Of Age Spots' (No Serum Will Do That), But I Do Like The Way It Helps Firm My Skin Before I Apply Makeup. But Then It Absorbs Well And Leaves My Skin A Bit Tighter And Smoother. One Reviewer Has Perfectly Described The Effect As Akin To Putting On Pantyhose -- Everything Just Feels Held Together Nicely.

I Can'T Honestly Say I Will Re-Order This, Because I Use A Pore Refiner That Does A Better Job Of Leaving My Face Makeup-Ready, And Vitamin C Serum Seems To Leave My Skin Clearer And Nicer. But This Works Well Enough That I Finished The Bottle.

For Those Who Want To Use Bamboo Serum, This One Is Probably Worth A Try. Take A Look At The Wide Variance In Product Pricing.
address: nan
review_text:
Not amazing, but a nice product. .
I had never used a "bamboo serum" when I ordered this and was curious about it.

Predictably, I can't tell that it 'helped supercharge collagen production,' or 'lift sagging skin,' or 'reduce the appearance of age spots' (no serum will do that), but I do like the way it helps firm my skin before I apply makeup. It has a sticky feel coming out of the bottle (mine came with a dropper rather than a pump), and it feels a bit odd going on -- sort of like rubbing mayonnaise into your skin. But then it absorbs well and leaves my skin a bit tighter and smoother. One reviewer has perfectly described the effect as akin to putting on pantyhose -- everything just feels held together nicely.

I can't honestly say I will re-order this, because I use a pore refiner that does a better job of leaving my face makeup-ready, and Vitamin C serum seems to leave my skin clearer and nicer. But this works well enough that I finished the bottle.

For those who want to use bamboo serum, this one is probably worth a try. Take a look at the wide variance in product pricing.

business_name:
Excellent Serum For All Skin Types I Am A Product Tester And Was Offered This Anti-Aging Serum By Sublime At A Special Price During A Promotion The Company Was Having; In Exchange, I Would Test Their Product And Give You My Honest Feedback. review_text:
Works well for my husband My husband has the worst acne on his back. We have tried body washes specifically for body acne and none has worked. I saw this 808Dude Facewash for acne and said why not try it. Summer is coming and his back is a mess. I bought him a puff on a stick and gave him this dude face wash and asked him to wash his back with it and see how it works.
Some of the ingredients are natural while some are not. The ingredients are- Aqua, Aloe Barbadensis (Aloe Vera) Extract Organic, Lauryl Glucoside, Decyl Glucoside, Cocamidopropyl Betaine, Sodium Cocoyl Glutamate, Certified Organic Glycerin and Aqua and Certified Organic Eleutherococcus Senticosus (Ginseng) and Parfum, Aqua and Glycerin and Paullinia Cupana Seed Extract (Guarana) and Citric Acid and Sodium Benzoate, Hamamelis Virginiana (Witch Hazel) Extract, Chamomilla Recutita (Chamomile) Extract, Citrus Aurantium Bergamia (Bergamot) Oil, Juniperus Virginiana (Cedarwood) Bark Oil, Pogostemon Cablin (Patchouli) Oil, Citrus Grandis (Grapefruit) Peel Oil, Lavandula Angustifolia (Lavender) Oil, Pelargonium Graveolens (Geranium) Oil, Melaleuca Alternifolia (Tea Tree) Leaf Oil, Helichrysum Italicum (Immortelle) Flower Oil, Coriandrum Sativum (Coriander) Oil, Glyceryl Caprylate, Potassium Sorbate, *Limonene, *Linalool, *Geraniol, *Citral, *Citronellol, *Benzyl Cinnamate *Component of Essential Oil.

review_text:
Wonderful! This is a thick, rich cream that, for me, has worked wonders on dry, scaly skin. My hands needed some serious help and after using this cream for just a few days, I have seen much improvement. My skin is much soft, the cracks are disappearing, and they feel moisturized. The cream is thick, a little goes a long way, and I’ve found it’s best to really rub it in, not list skim it over the skin and leave it. I have also been using the cream on a particularly itchy patch of skin on my back, again, with excellent results.
There is no scent.
The cream is made from several natural ingredients, most notably Manuka honey from New Zealand, something new to me, but that has been used for centuries in New Zealand. I’m glad it made its way to me in the USA!

business_name: Too Faced Devotee This Is The Most Used Palette In My Makeup Wardrobe. I Usually Use It For A Professional Everyday Look For Work. However , It Is Versatile Enough That I Can Intensify It For Evening Or Dressy Occasions Or Tone It Down For Subtly Enhancing A "No Makeup" Look. Because It Is Neutral And Universally Flattering On Almost All Skin Tones (May Not Show Up Well If You Have A Deep Toned Complexion), I Can Wear It With Any Color In My Wardrobe. I Also Like That It Has A Fantastic Cool Toned Set Of Colors That Do Not End Up Showing Up Blue Or Purple On The Skin. The Undertones Are Very Subtle, Just Like Real Skin! So Hard To Find - There Seems To Be A Profusion Of Warm Toned Makeup Out There, But Very Little Cool Or Neutral Toned Makeup That Produces A Smooth, Natural Looking And Flattering Gradient Of Color On The Skin. Nice Job, Too Faced! I Hope You Regard This As Your Flagship Palette And Never Discontinue This. Don'T Change The Formula Either!
address: nan
review_text: TOO FACED DEVOTEE This is the most used palette in my makeup wardrobe. I usually use it for a professional everyday look for work. However , it is versatile enough that I can intensify it for evening or dressy occasions or tone it down for subtly enhancing a "no makeup" look. Because it is neutral and universally flattering on almost all skin tones (may not show up well if you have a deep toned complexion), I can wear it with any color in my wardrobe. I also like that it has a fantastic cool toned set of colors that do not end up showing up blue or purple on the skin. The undertones are very subtle, just like real skin! So hard to find - there seems to be a profusion of warm toned makeup out there, but very little cool or neutral toned makeup that produces a smooth, natural looking and flattering gradient of color on the skin. Nice job, Too Faced! I hope you regard this as your flagship palette and never discontinue this. Don't change the formula either!

Bamboo Bristle Toothbrushes Have Historically Been One Of The Oldest Known Toothbrushes, Having Originated Out-Of-China, Over (500) Years Ago (Library Of Congress). The Bristles Were Made From Boars’ Hair And The Handle From Bamboo. Nylon Bristles Came About Around 1938. Today, Some Toothbrushes Still Use Boar’S Bristles, However, Some Say There Are Concerns About The Action Of The Natural Bristles On The Enamel And Gums, So Many Still Recommend Soft Nylon Bristles. Here, We Have A Natural Bamboo Handle, Which Is Sturdy And Durable, With Little To No Bend And Very Smooth, So Someone Took Time To Sand This Down. The Bristles Are Very Soft. Which Is Easy On The Gums And Enamel. The Toothbrush Head And Handle Are Perfect For A Little One’S Mouth, Allowing Access To Those Small To Reach Places. Practicing Good Oral Hygiene Is So Important, At A Young Age. Our Little One Found This Toothbrush Perfect In Size To Maneuver About And The Bristles Comfortable. We See No Shedding Of A Single Bristle At This Early Stage; And Plan To Rotate This Out Of Commission, After Its Effectiveness Appears Of Concern, After A Bad Cold, Or Just After So Many Months Of Service. With That In Mind, Cost Is Always A Concern. These Are No Bargain Basement Toothbrushes. They Are A Premium Product In Our Opinion And Are Priced Accordingly. Bamboo Toothbrush Handles Can Be Composted, Used As Kindling, And Can Be Repurposed For Other Household Uses. However, Just Like Plastic Toothbrush Handles, They Will Take Up Space In A Landfill If Just Thrown Away. We Reconsidered Using Plastic Toothbrushes, And Now Choose Bamboo Toothbrushes As An Alternative To The Plastic, Which Ends Up In Landfills. Plastic Is Not Designed To Break Down And Plastic Toothbrushes Are Difficult To Recycle. We Decided Bamboo To Be An Excellent Alternative To Reduce Plastic Waste At Home. Finally, Our Little One Gave This Bamboo Toothbrush, With Its Cute Design Laser Burned Into The Handle Two (2) Thumbs Up For Fit, Having That Fun Handle Design, Unique Style, Soft Bristle Comfort, Lack Of Odor, And Ease Of Using. We Agree.

Today, some toothbrushes still use boar’s bristles, however, some say there are concerns about the action of the natural bristles on the enamel and gums, so many still recommend soft nylon bristles. Here, we have a natural bamboo handle, which is sturdy and durable, with little to no bend and very smooth, so someone took time to sand this down. The bristles are very soft. Which is easy on the gums and enamel. The toothbrush head and handle are perfect for a little one’s mouth, allowing access to those small to reach places. Practicing good oral hygiene is so important, at a young age. Our little one found this toothbrush perfect in size to maneuver about and the bristles comfortable. We see no shedding of a single bristle at this early stage; and plan to rotate this out of commission, after its effectiveness appears of concern, after a bad cold, or just after so many months of service. With that in mind, cost is always a concern. These are no bargain basement toothbrushes. They are a premium product in our opinion and are priced accordingly. Bamboo toothbrush handles can be composted, used as kindling, and can be repurposed for other household uses. However, just like plastic toothbrush handles, they will take up space in a landfill if just thrown away. We reconsidered using plastic toothbrushes, and now choose bamboo toothbrushes as an alternative to the plastic, which ends up in landfills. business_name:
Love! Super Gentle Manual Exfoliation & Chemical Peeling Product; Deep Cleans Pores; Brightens I Am A Big Fan Of Neogen Products, And Korean Beauty Products In General. I Like That The Focus Tends To Be On Creating Healthy Glowing Skin Through Skin Loving Ingredients And Maximizing Hydration, Which All Skin Types Need. I Find These Neogen Real Charcoal Pads To Be Super Gentle, Non Irritating, Lightly Hydrating, Skin Brightening, Deep Cleaning Of Pores And Other Yucks On Skin. Skin Never Ever Tight, Never Irritated-- And I Have Non Acne Rosacea (Flushing, Telangiectasias/Veins).

I Hadn'T Used The Charcoal Pads Before, So I Was Excited To Try Them Out. There Are 60 Pads In A Tub With Twist Off Lid. One Side Of The Pad Is Quilted And You Can Clearly See The Charcoal Coloring. The Other Side Is Smooth. The Pads Are Quite Damp, And There Is Plenty Of Product On Them To Take Care Of Face And Neck, Or To Use As A Targeted "Sheet Mask". Avoid Eye Area.

Directions: After Washing, Swipe The Quilted Side Over Skin. Then Use Smooth Side To Pick Up Traces Of Impurities. Pat In Remaining Essence.

When I Swipe The Quilted Side Over My Skin, I Like To Go Slow With Gentle Pressure. I Allow The Product To Sit For A Moment Before Flipping The Pad Over To The Smooth Side (More White Than Gray) And Wipe My Face. One Side Applies The Product, The Other Helps To Lift Up What Is Left Behind- Or Brought To Surface As It Is Meant To Draw Out Impurities And Wastes. I Noticed That The Pad Was Turning Tan/Brownish Leading Me To Believe That These Pads Were Indeed Doing A Good Job Of Breaking Down Excess Junk On My Face (Despite A Good Cleansing) And Leaving My Skin Feeling Supple And Clean. I Followed The Directions That State To Pat In Any Excess Product. I Wasn'T Sure Whether To Follow Up With My Hydrating Toners, Or Skip To My Hyaluronic Acid (Ha). Since Skin Needs Moisture To Make Ha Most Effective, I Patted On One Layer Of Hydrating Toner, A Layer Of Ha, Followed By A Moisturizer To Help Lock In The Hydration. I Think This Charcoal Pad Is Gentle Enough To Use Daily, If Need Be. However, I Have Been Using It 2-3X A Week. You Will Have To Experiment To See What Is Best For You. My 40 Something Rosacea Skin Is Sensitive, Leans Dry, And Loves Hydration. My Skin Can Use An Occasional Boost In Really Purifying My Pores And Such. I Am Really Liking This Product So Far. It Just Feels So Gentle On My Skin!

Benefits, And A Little More Info:

--Charcoal Powder And Peeling Essence Ingredient- Hydroxycinnamic Acid- Provide Double Synergy Effect For Absorbing Sebum And Removing Dead Skin Cells. The Charcoal Powder Delivers Gentle Yet Effective Adsorption Benefit To Draw Impurities, While Hypoallergenic Peeling Essence (Hydroxycinnamic Acid) Provides Manual Exfoliation Combined With Chemical Peeling Effect.

--Manual Exfoliation + Chemical Peeling Effect.
--With Two Sides Including Charcoal Pad That Cleanses The Skin And Embossing Pad That Softly Purifies The Skin.

--Pore Clarifying: Formulated With Natural Peat Water And Charcoal Powder(310 Ppm), These Help To Draw Deep-Seated Sebum, Whiteheads, Dead Skin Cells, And Other Impurities Out Of Pores For Smoother And Clearer Skin.

--Gentle Peeling: Neogen Pha™ Removes Dead Skin Cells And Impurities Without Irritation Or Discomfort While Leaving The Skin Radiantly Hydrated And Smooth. Softly Cleanses Skin, Non Irritating.

--Skin Soothing: Teca™ Formula (Titrated Extract Of Centella Asiatica) Delivers A Soothing Benefit To Skin; Helps Create Bright Skin. Centella Asiatica Has Potent Antioxidant Properties, Rich Source Of Amino Acids, And There'S Additional Research Showing That It'S A Good Hydrating Ingredient To Soothe Upset Or Compromised Skin.

Ingredients:
Water, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Dipropylene Glycol, 1,2-Hexanediol, Betaine, Panthenol, Charcoal Powder(310Ppm), Peat Water, Asiaticoside, Madecassic Acid, Asiatic Acid, Acacia Senegal Gum, Cetearyl Olivate, Sorbitan Olivate, Allantoin, Gluconolactone, Citrus Aurantium Bergamia (Bergamot) Fruit Oil, Glyceryl Caprylate, Tromethamine, Ethylhexylglycerin, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Xanthan Gum, Propanediol, Citric Acid, Hydroxypropyl Methylcellulose, Alcohol, Rutin, Hydroxycinnamic Acid, Potassium Sorbate, Disodium Edta
address: nan
review_text:
LOVE! super gentle manual exfoliation & chemical peeling product; deep cleans pores; brightens I am a big fan of Neogen products, and Korean beauty products in general. I like that the focus tends to be on creating healthy glowing skin through skin loving ingredients and maximizing hydration, which all skin types need. I find these Neogen Real Charcoal Pads to be super gentle, non irritating, lightly hydrating, skin brightening, deep cleaning of pores and other yucks on skin. Skin never ever tight, never irritated-- and I have non acne ROSACEA (flushing, telangiectasias/veins).

I hadn't used the charcoal pads before, so I was excited to try them out. There are 60 pads in a tub with twist off lid. One side of the pad is quilted and you can clearly see the charcoal coloring. The other side is smooth. The pads are quite damp, and there is plenty of product on them to take care of face and neck, or to use as a targeted "sheet mask". Avoid eye area.

DIRECTIONS: AFTER washing, swipe the quilted side over skin. Then use smooth side to pick up traces of impurities. Pat in remaining essence.

When I swipe the quilted side over my skin, I like to go slow with gentle pressure. I allow the product to sit for a moment before flipping the pad over to the smooth side (more white than gray) and wipe my face. One side applies the product, the other helps to lift up what is left behind- or brought to surface as it is meant to draw out impurities and wastes. I noticed that the pad was turning tan/brownish leading me to believe that these pads were indeed doing a good job of breaking down excess junk on my face (despite a good cleansing) and leaving my skin feeling supple and clean. I followed the directions that state to pat in any excess product. I wasn't sure whether to follow up with my hydrating toners, or skip to my Hyaluronic Acid (HA). Since skin needs moisture to make HA most effective, I patted on one layer of hydrating toner, a layer of HA, followed by a moisturizer to help lock in the hydration. I think this charcoal pad is gentle enough to use daily, if need be. However, I have been using it 2-3x a week. You will have to experiment to see what is best for you. My 40 something rosacea skin is sensitive, leans dry, and loves hydration. My skin can use an occasional boost in really purifying my pores and such. I am really liking this product so far. It just feels so gentle on my skin!

Benefits, and a little more info:

--Charcoal powder and peeling essence ingredient- Hydroxycinnamic Acid- provide double synergy effect for absorbing sebum and removing dead skin cells. The charcoal powder delivers gentle yet effective adsorption benefit to draw impurities, while hypoallergenic peeling essence (Hydroxycinnamic Acid) provides manual exfoliation combined with chemical peeling effect.

--Manual exfoliation + chemical peeling effect.
--With two sides including Charcoal pad that cleanses the skin and embossing pad that softly purifies the skin.

--Pore clarifying: Formulated with natural Peat water and Charcoal powder(310 ppm), these help to draw deep-seated sebum, whiteheads, dead skin cells, and other impurities out of pores for smoother and clearer skin.

--Gentle Peeling: NEOGEN PHA™ removes dead skin cells and impurities without irritation or discomfort while leaving the skin radiantly hydrated and smooth. Softly cleanses skin, non irritating.

--Skin soothing: TECA™ formula (Titrated Extract of Centella Asiatica) delivers a soothing benefit to skin; helps create bright skin. Centella Asiatica has potent antioxidant properties, rich source of amino acids, and there's additional research showing that it's a good hydrating ingredient to soothe upset or compromised skin.

INGREDIENTS:
Water, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Dipropylene Glycol, 1,2-Hexanediol, Betaine, Panthenol, Charcoal Powder(310ppm), Peat Water, Asiaticoside, Madecassic Acid, Asiatic Acid, Acacia Senegal Gum, Cetearyl Olivate, Sorbitan Olivate, Allantoin, Gluconolactone, Citrus Aurantium Bergamia (Bergamot) Fruit Oil, Glyceryl Caprylate, Tromethamine, Ethylhexylglycerin, Acrylates/C10-30 Alkyl Acrylate Crosspolymer, Xanthan Gum, Propanediol, Citric Acid, Hydroxypropyl Methylcellulose, Alcohol, Rutin, Hydroxycinnamic Acid, Potassium Sorbate, Disodium EDTA

review_text:
Perhaps a misleading product name? (update to this review) After researching more, and experimenting more, I am amending this review. What I had written before turned out to be such a complicated and long commentary, that I decided to simplify the review to a simple paragraph.

At first, I had a problem with the product, but then found it was my error. When bathing, I had washed my hair twice, and later noticed I got some scalp itching. Then I found out that you're not supposed to wash your hair twice with ANY shampoo, as it will strip the oils out, and make your head itch. So, three days later, I used it again, but only once. That was just fine. The problem did not repeat. I've since tried the Unscented version of this product, and like it too.

business_name:
Simple To Use & Perfect Results Every Time!! I Love These Bun Makers!! I Have An Old Bun Maker That I'Ve Been Using For Years, But That One Just Got Tossed In The Trash Because These New Ones Are So Much Easier To Use And The Finished Product Looks Much Better!! These Bun Makers Are Unique In That They Are Foam, Which Helps To Grip Your Hair To Better Hold It In Place. They Also Have A Very Strong Inner Wire That Holds Them In Place In A Perfect Circle. I Have Relatively Long (Just Past My Bust Line) Hair With Long Layers - The Trick To Getting All Of The End Pieces Of The Layers To Stay Tucked In Place Is To Pull The Bun Maker Down The Length Of Your Ponytail Just Before You Reach The End Of The Shortest Layer. Then, Fold All Of The Rest Of The Ends Upward Over The Hair Piece And Tuck Them Inward Towards The Center Of The Ponytail. As You Roll The Hair Piece Upwards, Continue To Tuck Any Loose Ends In So That They Are Held In Place By The Rolled Hair. The Other Trick To Getting A Perfectly Round Bun Is That Once You Have Rolled The Hair Piece All The Way Up With Your Hair, Fold The Ends Inward Towards Each Other To Form A Circle, But Make Sure To Tighten This Circle As Much As Possible By Pushing The Ends As Close Together As You Can. Otherwise, These Hair Pieces Are Fairly Self-Explanatory To Use, And There Are Step-By-Step Instructions Included With Each Of The Four Bun Maker Pieces. In Addition To These Four Pieces, This Product Also Includes 2 Sets Of 8 Bobby Pins -- 1 Set Is About 2&Quot; Long Each And The Other Set Is About 3&Quot; Long.
*I Received This Product At A Discounted Price In Exchange For An Honest, Unbiased Review.
address: nan
review_text:
Simple to Use & Perfect Results Every Time!! I LOVE these bun makers!! I have an old bun maker that I've been using for years, but that one just got tossed in the trash because these new ones are SO much easier to use and the finished product looks much better!! These bun makers are unique in that they are foam, which helps to grip your hair to better hold it in place. They also have a very strong inner wire that holds them in place in a perfect circle. I have relatively long (just past my bust line) hair with long layers - the trick to getting all of the end pieces of the layers to stay tucked in place is to pull the bun maker down the length of your ponytail just before you reach the end of the shortest layer. Then, fold all of the rest of the ends upward over the hair piece and tuck them inward towards the center of the ponytail. As you roll the hair piece upwards, continue to tuck any loose ends in so that they are held in place by the rolled hair. The other trick to getting a perfectly round bun is that once you have rolled the hair piece all the way up with your hair, fold the ends inward towards each other to form a circle, but make sure to tighten this circle as much as possible by pushing the ends as close together as you can. Otherwise, these hair pieces are fairly self-explanatory to use, and there are step-by-step instructions included with each of the four bun maker pieces. In addition to these four pieces, this product also includes 2 sets of 8 bobby pins -- 1 set is about 2" long each and the other set is about 3" long.
*I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for an honest, unbiased review.

review_text: Easy to use and wash out, not for long hair This product is actually really cool and just as easy to use in real life as it seems like in the pictures. Comes with a silvery tone putty type substance in a little container all you have to do is put your hands in kind of rub it around your hands and then run it through your hair. It was really the easy to do on someone else but takes a little bit more time to do on yourself though if you get some on your skin or ears or wherever you can just take a wet damp towel or a white or something like that and wipe it right off. In the picture that shows you doing it too long hair but I tried it on my long hair and absolutely did not work I could not pull a comb through it and it was hard and strange and it definitely works better on men's hair that is short. When it was dry it got kind of hard like a gel or something like that. It's really easy to make it look nice you just have to continue working it through the hair until you get the desired color and style that you want. We tried it on a beard as well and it didn't look as good on the beard it kind of looked better on the medium to short hair but not super super short like a beard. We even used it and my boyfriend's hair who is African-American and it came out pretty cool. Kind of makes you look like you have silver gray hair. It was really easy to wash out renting it out just with water gets a lot of it off but a little bit of shampoo get it out in just a second. I don't recommend going to bed with this in your hair as it will leave silver glimmery stuff on your pillowcase to make sure you wash before going to sleep or laying down on anything.

business_name: Loaded With Hydration & Plant Extracts That My Skin Needs During The Winter Months!! These Masks Have Become A Favorite This Fall And Winter When My Skin Needs An Extra Dose Of Hydration.  I'Ve Just Turned 50 And It'S A Constant Battle To Keep My Skin Hydrated Just Due To The Aging Process.  When You Add In Cold, Dry Air Outside And Hot, Dry Air Inside It Just Makes It So Much More Difficult.  I'Ve Been Adding Masks To My Skincare Routine This Winter And They'Ve Made A Huge Difference.  I Try To Do At Least One A Week, But As It Gets Colder I'Ve Been Using Them Every Few Days.  I'Ll Use Them At Night After I'Ve Cleansed And Used My Prescription Skincare And Then I'Ll Follow Up With My Nightly Routine.  I Love All Of The Plant Extracts Loaded Into This One Along With The Niacinamide And Hyaluronic Acid.  One Thing To Keep In Mind Though Is That If You'Re Using This (Or Anything With Hyaluronic Acid, Really) And You'Re In A Dry Climate You Need To Make Sure You Provide Additional Moisture For The Ha To Bind To.  It'S Why I Use This One At Night Since I Keep A Humidifier Running On My Bedside Table That Pumps That Moisture Into The Air.  In Addition To The Hydration It Also Does A Great Job Of Noticeably Minimizing The Appearance Of Some Of Larger Pores On My Face Which Of Course Makes My Skin Look Firmer And Smoother.
address: nan
review_text: Loaded with hydration & plant extracts that my skin NEEDS during the winter months!! These masks have become a favorite this fall and winter when my skin needs an extra dose of hydration. I've just turned 50 and it's a constant battle to keep my skin hydrated just due to the aging process. When you add in cold, dry air outside and hot, dry air inside it just makes it so much more difficult. I've been adding masks to my skincare routine this winter and they've made a huge difference. I try to do at LEAST one a week, but as it gets colder I've been using them every few days. I'll use them at night after I've cleansed and used my prescription skincare and then I'll follow up with my nightly routine. I love all of the plant extracts loaded into this one along with the niacinamide and hyaluronic acid. One thing to keep in mind though is that if you're using this (or anything with hyaluronic acid, really) and you're in a dry climate you need to make sure you provide additional moisture for the HA to bind to. It's why I use this one at night since I keep a humidifier running on my bedside table that pumps that moisture into the air. In addition to the hydration it also does a great job of noticeably minimizing the appearance of some of larger pores on my face which of course makes my skin look firmer and smoother.

business_name:
I Love These Nails, But... I Bought This Because I Was Wanting To Try Fiberglass Without Spending A Ton On Something I Might Hate. I Definitely Do Not Hate These Nails! They Are Thin And Natural Looking, And Still Super Strong. I Will Absolutely Continue Using Fiberglass Nails.

But... They Are A Bit Of A Pain To Use, And Some Of That Pain Is Actual, Physical Pain From Getting Fiberglass Stuck In Your Skin. I'D Advise Using Gloves, And Will Follow My Own Advice On That Going Forward. Fiberglass Is Actual Wee Little Glass Fibers Which Are Nearly Impossible To See And Remove When You Get A Bit Stuck In Your Skin And Can Be Really Irritating And Painful. I Ended Up Smearing My Hands With Tacky Glue, Letting It Dry, And Then Peeling It Off To Get Rid Of The It. It Worked Pretty Well, But Yeah, Gloves.

The Gel In This Set Cured Well, And As I Said, My Nails Are Very Strong. I Used Young Nails Protien Bond And The Base Coat, And So Far No Lifting Whatsoever, When I Usually Would Start Seeing Some.

The Little Led Light Is Cute, But I Wouldn'T Ever Use It For Curing Nails. I Have A Better Light And I Halved The Recommending Curing Times Since They'Re Given For The Tiny Lamp.

There'S A Little Tin Of Loose Fibers, Which I'M Not Sure How To Use.

The Set Also Comes With Two Completely Useless Pairs Of Tweezers, Which I Just Tossed.
address: nan
review_text:
I love these nails, but... I bought this because I was wanting to try fiberglass without spending a ton on something I might hate. I definitely do not hate these nails! They are thin and natural looking, and still super strong. I will absolutely continue using fiberglass nails.

BUT... They are a bit of a pain to use, and some of that pain is actual, physical pain from getting fiberglass stuck in your skin. I'd advise using gloves, and will follow my own advice on that going forward. Fiberglass is actual wee little glass fibers which are nearly impossible to see and remove when you get a bit stuck in your skin and can be really irritating and painful. I ended up smearing my hands with tacky glue, letting it dry, and then peeling it off to get rid of the it. It worked pretty well, but yeah, gloves.

The gel in this set cured well, and as I said, my nails are very strong. I used Young Nails Protien Bond and the base coat, and so far no lifting whatsoever, when I usually would start seeing some.

The little LED light is cute, but I wouldn't ever use it for curing nails. I have a better light and I halved the recommending curing times since they're given for the tiny lamp.

There's a little tin of loose fibers, which I'm not sure how to use.

The set also comes with two completely useless pairs of tweezers, which I just tossed.

I Did Receive This Product At A Discount Or For Free In Exchange For My Honest And Unbiased Review. I Do Express My Reviews Honestly By The Actual Experience I Have With The Product.
address: nan
review_text:
so I am satisfied with this cream This cream has actually made a slight difference so far. I have been using this for almost two weeks and I'm starting to notice my breasts do feel fuller. They are still the same size but the shape has improved. I am a former bf mom so they are not as perky as they once were. I wouldn't say this is a replacement for surgery or anything though. For me just seeing any improvement is exciting, so I am satisfied with this cream. I wasn't really expecting this to work in the beginning, I began to see a difference around the third day. I used it twice a day.

The smell is a little different. It was musky to me. It doesn't smell bad.. but it could be better. The size is probably enough for a few months, I still have tons so a little goes a long way. The consistency is thick and really blendable. A little nickel sized amount is about what I use each time because it spreads easily. It really just feels like lotion on your skin, it isn't sticky or gel like.

The only thing I didn't like about this was the fragrance, the scent is not a scent I would normally wear but since it does seem to benefit my breasts it
Is a scent I can live with, I just spray perfume over my shirt and it covers it up.

Overall I am happy about this cream, even with the change being suttle so far it still has some affect and that's better than nothing for me. I'm hoping I see more improvement with this in the long run and I will continue using it.

I did receive this product at a discount or for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. I do express my reviews honestly by the actual experience I have with the product.

business_name:
Works Well, But Has A Minor Design Flaw I Have Used Ionizing Brushes For Over 30 Years—Since They Were First Sold By Sharper Image. The Negative Ions Work Very Well To Flatten The Surface Of The Cuticle Of Each Hair, Making The Hair Less Likely To Break Or Split, And Also Softer.

This Particular Brush Works Well, But The One I Received Has A Minor Design Flaw: The Brush Part Pops Off So Easily That I Have To Hold It Tight With My Thumb, Making It Less Ergonomic Than It Might Be... Not An Issue For Me. As For The Vibrating Part, I Couldn'T Tell, But That'S Not What I Bought It For. This Brush Generates No Heat, Which Is Exactly What I Wanted. Unlike Some Similar Products, There Are No Seams That Could Catch The Hair.

Tips For All Ionizing Brushes:
(1) If They Don'T Need Electricity (Cord Or Batteries), They'Re Not The Real Deal
(2) Heating Elements, Just Like Heated Blow-Drying, Tend To Dry Out Your Hair And Make It More Brittle: Even Oily Hair Can Get Dried Out
(3) Brush Your Hair Slowly To Get The Best Result
(4) If Your Hair Is Flatter After Using It, And You Don'T Like That, Bend Over And Brush It Upside Down To Get More Volume
address: nan
review_text:
works well, but has a minor design flaw I have used ionizing brushes for over 30 years—since they were first sold by Sharper Image. The negative ions work very well to flatten the surface of the cuticle of each hair, making the hair less likely to break or split, and also softer.

This particular brush works well, but the one I received has a minor design flaw: the brush part pops off so easily that I have to hold it tight with my thumb, making it less ergonomic than it might be... not an issue for me. As for the vibrating part, I couldn't tell, but that's not what I bought it for. This brush generates NO heat, which is exactly what I wanted. Unlike some similar products, there are NO seams that could catch the hair.

TIPS FOR ALL IONIZING BRUSHES:
(1) if they don't need electricity (cord or batteries), they're not the real deal
(2) heating elements, just like heated blow-drying, tend to dry out your hair and make it more brittle: even oily hair can get dried out
(3) brush your hair SLOWLY to get the best result
(4) if your hair is flatter after using it, and you don't like that, bend over and brush it upside down to get more volume

The parting space has a small linear band like area, across that is alike lace front, a little over a centimetre.
This where you can do, if you chose to, use spray or gel, for extra security.
This wig has density. It is not thin. It may thin out towards the bottom.
However from scalp to 24 inches, You've got a lot of Hair. It's NOT WIGGY.
I have not altered this wig in any of the photos, other than the lopping off the length.
I did not use thinning shears on Her.

I use a Mannequin Head, I assess and then use my Wahl Clippers and lop off the bottom, slowly.
28 inches is great, you can then alter the wig to different lengths, before it's been loved too much, unable to wear.

business_name: Well Made Unit This Is An Extremely Well-Made Unit And Appears Completely Waterproof.  It Charges In About An Hour With A Charge That Lasts Me Four Showers.  While It Removes Some Skin I Would Prefer Stiffer Rubber “Bristles.”  The Handle Is Made Of A Slippery Plastic That Is Impossible To Hang Into With Soapy Hands.  Probably Ok For The Bathtub, But Risky In The Shower.  Men Usually Have Larger Backs And Are Less Flexible.  So I Made A Longer “Handle” With A 12” Pvc Pipe, Attached With A Gasket And A Hose Clamp, Easily Removed For Charging.  The Pipe Also Doesn’T Slip In A Soapy Hand.  With All The Running Gear In The Head The Unit Is Top Heavy When In The Charger.  Even The Suction Cups On The Charger Base Can’T Hold It Upright.  However, The Gasket For The Handle Also Pushes The Unit Enough Off Center To Balance It And Prevent Fall Overs.  The Instruction Sheet Is A Riot.  It Reads Like It Was Run From Chinese Through A Translation Program Into “English.”  The Best Line Is “Especially Designed With Horny Brush And Thus Removing Residual Horniness.”  If Only It Were So Simple!  It Should Be Rewritten By A Native English Speaker.
address: nan
review_text: Well Made Unit This is an extremely well-made unit and appears completely waterproof. It charges in about an hour with a charge that lasts me four showers. While it removes some skin I would prefer stiffer rubber “bristles.” The handle is made of a slippery plastic that is impossible to hang into with soapy hands. Probably OK for the bathtub, but risky in the shower. Men usually have larger backs and are less flexible. So I made a longer “handle” with a 12” PVC pipe, attached with a gasket and a hose clamp, easily removed for charging. The pipe also doesn’t slip in a soapy hand. With all the running gear in the head the unit is top heavy when in the charger. Even the suction cups on the charger base can’t hold it upright. However, the gasket for the handle also pushes the unit enough off center to balance it and prevent fall overs. The instruction sheet is a riot. It reads like it was run from Chinese through a translation program into “English.” The best line is “Especially designed with horny brush and thus removing residual horniness.” If only it were so simple! It should be rewritten by a native English speaker.

address: nan
review_text:
Like just name it I have tried SO MANY facial blotting papers. Like just name it, I've tried it.. from Sephora, Ulta, Ebay, Amazon.. just believe me. These are the best!

Other blotting tissues are just that, super thin barely tissues that barely soak up oil before the papers turn translucent. So you end up using like 5 sheets for your whole face, and even then I don't feel clean. With these, the sheets are thick and coated, but it's not powdery. You press the light colored end on your face and it soaks up the oil and turns the area black! And it really does soak up oil, but leaves makeup intact. I use only one sheet for my whole face to feel clean, and a second sheet if I'm in a humid area. Then a facial mist. It's definitely the best blotting sheets you can find out there!

business_name:
We'Ll See How Long This Lasts... Provides A Decent Shave, Particularly After The Beard Has Been Moistened As It Is Immediately After A Shower. The Question Is, For How Long, Considering The Flimsy Construction Of Some Components And The Already Below-Specified Battery Life.

Things They Don'T Describe In The Mostly Worthless Manual:

The Charging Indicator Is A Steady Red Ac Plug Symbol.

The Lcd Indication At Full Charge Is 99. A Red (Not A Far More Intuitive Green) Battery Full Symbol Is Shown At When The Charge Reaches 99.

A Low Battery Is Indicated By A Flashing Red Ac Plug Symbol When The Charge Number On The Lcd Reaches 10.

Charge Time Was Tested And Found To Be 82 Minutes. The Manual Claims 60 To 90 Minutes, So They Got That Right.

Use Time Is Specified In The Manual As 50 To 60 Minutes. The Run Time Was Tested And Found To Be Only 30 Minutes In 5 Minute On, Five Minute Off Intervals, Just Free Running And Not Being Used To Shave Which Should Further Reduce The Run Time Slightly.

The Charge Indicator Was At 52 After 25 Minutes And Then Rapidly Dropped From That To 10 Only Five Minutes Later Causing The Low Battery Indicator To Flash, So I Would Definitely Not Trust The Charge Indicator To Be An Accurate Indication Of How Much Shaving Time You Have Left. They Are Apparently Not Calculating Percent Charge Remaining And Displaying It On The Lcd, They Are Simply And Far Less Usefully Displaying Percent Battery Voltage Which Drops Off Rapidly At What Is Called The Battery'S Discharge "Knee." A Cheap Route To Take Revealing That The Lcd Display Is Nothing More Useful Than A Gimmick.

The Manual States That The Razor Should Be Unplugged From The Charger (This Razor Package Does Not Come With An Ac To Usb Charge Adapter) When The Charge Number Reaches 99, So I Suspect This Charger Might Not Have An Intelligent Charger Which Stops The Battery Charge Process At Full Charge To Avoid Battery Damage Over The Long Term. So, I Will Not Put This Razor On Charge And Just Forget About It Until My Next Shave Like I Can With My Norelco With Its Intelligent Charge System.

Other Information:

The Space Under The Heads Which Catches The Beard Shavings Is Very Small. Cleaning Often Will Be A Must. We'Ll See How The Hinge And Head Locking Mechanism Hold Up.

When Opening The Shaving Head To Clean, Put A Finger On It To Slow Its Opening, Otherwise It Will Rapidly Flip Open And If A Razor Element Isn'T Locked Into Its Place By Its Flimsy And Not Very Intuitive To Correctly Replace Locking Ring, As It Wasn'T In My Case, The Razor Element And Its Parts Will Be Vigorously Projected Into An Alternate Universe. Luckily, I Found All Of The Parts. Had I Been Standing Over A Sink, Some Could Easily Have Gone Down The Drain. We'Ll See How The Razor Element Locking Rings Hold Up.
address: nan
review_text:
We'll see how long this lasts... Provides a decent shave, particularly after the beard has been moistened as it is immediately after a shower. The question is, for how long, considering the flimsy construction of some components and the already below-specified battery life.

Things they don't describe in the mostly worthless manual:

The charging indicator is a steady red AC plug symbol.

The LCD indication at full charge is 99. A RED (not a far more intuitive GREEN) battery full symbol is shown at when the charge reaches 99.

A low battery is indicated by a flashing red AC plug symbol when the charge number on the LCD reaches 10.

Charge time was tested and found to be 82 minutes. The manual claims 60 to 90 minutes, so they got that right.

Use time is specified in the manual as 50 to 60 minutes. The run time was tested and found to be only 30 minutes in 5 minute on, five minute off intervals, just free running and not being used to shave which should further reduce the run time slightly.

The charge indicator was at 52 after 25 minutes and then rapidly dropped from that to 10 only five minutes later causing the low battery indicator to flash, so I would definitely NOT trust the charge indicator to be an accurate indication of how much shaving time you have left. They are apparently not calculating percent charge remaining and displaying it on the LCD, they are simply and far less usefully displaying percent battery VOLTAGE which drops off rapidly at what is called the battery's discharge "knee." A cheap route to take revealing that the LCD display is nothing more useful than a gimmick.

The manual states that the razor should be unplugged from the charger (this razor package does not come with an AC to USB charge adapter) when the charge number reaches 99, so I suspect this charger might not have an intelligent charger which stops the battery charge process at full charge to avoid battery damage over the long term. So, I will not put this razor on charge and just forget about it until my next shave like I can with my Norelco with its intelligent charge system.

Other information:

The space under the heads which catches the beard shavings is very small. Cleaning often will be a must. We'll see how the hinge and head locking mechanism hold up.

When opening the shaving head to clean, put a finger on it to slow its opening, otherwise it will rapidly flip open and if a razor element isn't locked into its place by its flimsy and not very intuitive to correctly replace locking ring, as it wasn't in my case, the razor element and its parts will be vigorously projected into an alternate universe. Luckily, I found all of the parts. Had I been standing over a sink, some could easily have gone down the drain. We'll see how the razor element locking rings hold up.

Highly, highly recommended. Try it. There were only 4 reviews of tthis product, but the ingredients are true, pure, and wonderful!

business_name:
The Real "Miracle In A Jar" For Me! I'Ve Been A User Of The Alpha Hydrox Products For Several Years. I'M 38 Going On 39, And Some People Still Mistake Me For 25 To Early 30'S. I Especially Love The 12% Souffle Cream. Trust Me, If You Purchase This Product, It Will Work So Well That You May Take It For Granted Someday. Don'T! I Made That Mistake, And It Almost Cost Me My Skin!

I Had Run Out Of The Souffle And Was Lazy One Day When Repurchasing My Skin Care Products, So I Bought A Drugstore Brand Of A Popular New "Simply Radiant" Skin Care System With Fancy "Soy Proteins" In It. I Wanted To Even Out My Skin Tone (African-American, With A Couple Of Dark Dots Left Over From A Few Small Pimples). After Using The Moisturizer For A Week, I Started Developing Cystic Acne-Type Bumps On My Face!! Big Pus-Filled Lumps That Developed In Clusters On My Cheeks And Forehead. I Was Horrified. I Immediately Stopped Using The Moisturizer, And The Cysts Stopped Developing, But The Damage Was Done; I Had Slowly-Healing Cystic Acne Bumps On My Face. When I Returned The Cream To The Drug Store, The Clerk Took One Look At Me And Quickly Gave Me My Money Back; The Bad Skin Reaction Was That Obvious.

I Ordered The Alpha Hydrox 12% Souffle As Soon As I Could, Along With The Alpha Hydrox 14% Aha Swipes To Help Accelerate My Skin Exfoliation. I Used The Swipes 3 Times A Week, And The Souffle Morning And Night. After A Month, I Finally Got The Acne Under Control. After Two Months, My Skin Was Smooth Again. After Six Months, I Was Able To Take The Most Gorgeous Headshots I'Ve Ever Had Done, And The Graphic Artist Only Had To Retouch "Shine" On My Forehead And Chin. There'S Only A Pinhead-Sized Indentation Left Over From The Acne Scars, And All The Deep-Colored Hyperpigmented Spots Have Completely Healed And Disappeared. My Skin Is Baby-Smooth, Even Toned, And If I Had Told You That Approximately Eight Months Ago I Had Deep Acne Scars On My Face, You Would Never Believe Me.

I'M Back To Just The Souffle Morning And Evening For Maintenance, But I'Ll Never Take Using My Alpha Hydrox Products For Granted Ever Again!
address: nan
review_text:
The Real "Miracle In A Jar" For Me! I've been a user of the Alpha Hydrox products for several years. I'm 38 going on 39, and some people still mistake me for 25 to early 30's. I especially love the 12% Souffle cream. Trust me, if you purchase this product, it will work SO well that you may take it for granted someday. Don't! I made that mistake, and it almost cost me my skin!

I had run out of the souffle and was lazy one day when repurchasing my skin care products, so I bought a drugstore brand of a popular new "Simply Radiant" skin care system with fancy "Soy Proteins" in it. I wanted to even out my skin tone (African-American, with a couple of dark dots left over from a few small pimples). After using the moisturizer for a week, I started developing cystic acne-type bumps on my face!! BIG pus-filled lumps that developed in clusters on my cheeks and forehead. I was horrified. I immediately stopped using the moisturizer, and the cysts stopped developing, but the damage was done; I had slowly-healing cystic acne bumps on my face. When I returned the cream to the drug store, the clerk took one look at me and quickly gave me my money back; the bad skin reaction was that obvious.

I ordered the Alpha Hydrox 12% Souffle as soon as I could, along with the Alpha Hydrox 14% AHA swipes to help accelerate my skin exfoliation. I used the swipes 3 times a week, and the souffle morning and night. After a month, I finally got the acne under control. After two months, my skin was smooth again. After six months, I was able to take the most gorgeous headshots I've ever had done, and the graphic artist only had to retouch "shine" on my forehead and chin. There's only a pinhead-sized indentation left over from the acne scars, and all the deep-colored hyperpigmented spots have completely healed and disappeared. My skin is baby-smooth, even toned, and if I had told you that approximately eight months ago I had deep acne scars on my face, you would never believe me.

I'm back to just the Souffle morning and evening for maintenance, but I'll NEVER take using my Alpha Hydrox products for granted ever again!

Stays on! This eyeliner is really saturated, so it goes on easily. It’s great for making a clean line. It dries quickly once it’s on, but it doesn’t feel dry going on. My main problem with other eyeliners that I’ve tried is that they don’t stay on long. Other waterproof eyeliners either are so dry that they don’t go on easily or it’s going to smear or come off before I want it to, especially since I have oily skin. But this actually stays on for the longest time! It doesn’t come off until you use warm water or make up remover, and then it comes off very fast without a problem. It might not be waterproof in the sense of going swimming or taking a shower and expecting it to stay on, but if you are like me and use waterproof eyeliner because other eyeliners tend to smear or fade by the end of the day then you will love this.
By the way, I have several Canmake cosmetics now and the ones I have so far are just as good as department store/high end cosmetics but cost much less.
